Hello I'm Matthew Ruggiero

I'm a Front-End Developer, Drupal Developer, UX/UI Architect, Webmaster, and Costume Maker!

The power of first impressions cannot be underestimated, and the gateway to capitalizing on them lies in exceptional website design. An outstanding website transcends mere aesthetics and extends its influence to encompass seamless functionality and a user-friendly navigation and experience. Drawing upon my expertise as a seasoned programmer, I possess the unique ability to tackle intricate technical challenges while crafting websites that exude sleekness and visual allure. Moreover, my extensive knowledge of recognized technical standards is complemented by my proficiency in modern building practices, ensuring that every aspect of your website is finely tuned to perfection.

Check out a few of my latest projects

NGOsource was an existing Drupal site that had a few redesigns and many features added to it during my time at TechSoup. I also helped TechSoup migrate the site from Drupal 7 to Drupal 9. My most recent addition was to the ngos learning center, the learning center is a resource for NGOs to use to familiarize themselves with what is required of them to take advantage of TechSoup's products and FAQs. I used the views module to organize the data and jquery and SASS to style the pages.

NGOsource

The 10 year retrospective site for NGOsource was a big challenge for me. The team that needed the site needed it in 4 weeks. I helped them throughout the entire process, from concepts and content, to design, to development, to bug fixes, to redesigns and finally to PRODUCTION. I re-used some assets and designs I had previously created in the GRAV CMS to speed up development and used twig, javascript and SASS to build out the different pages and the theme.

10 Year Retrospective of NGOsource

Accelerating Makers was an interesting project. It was a site that our director wanted built for a project of his and another manager. They also wanted the site in 4 weeks. Similar to the 10 year retrospective of NGOsource I used the GRAV CMS and what assets I could reuse to build out the site quickly. However the design team was busy on other projects and I got to design the site. I was in charge of the entire process, from concepts, to design, to development, to PROD.

Accelerating Makers

The TechSoup Global Network or TSGN was my first site I built with the team using GRAV CMS. It's a multi-lingual site the show cased all the good TechSoups network of non-profits did globally. I personally worked on the focus areas page, the impact page and the contact form page.

TechSoup Global Network

Another site I helped the team build using GRAV CMS. I personally worked on the about page, get involved page, and the contact form page.

TechSoup Americas

I helped build the 2016, 2018, 2020, 2021, and 2022 year in review sites for TechSoup. We used GRAV for these sites too, I personally worked on the letter from the CEO pages, timeline pages and data & impact pages.

TechSoup Year in Review

Get Forky was a site I built for a friend who worked for pequod communications. My friend did the design portion and I developed the site. I only used html, css (less/sass) and javascript to build the site and used some plugins for the menus and order forms.

Get Forky

This GRAV site was very similar to TechSoup Americas, we reused almost all the assets and themes from TS Americas with minimal modification.

TechSoup Africa

NetSquared was a Drupal site that hosted educational events centered around technology and how to utlilize it for your non-profit. It also hosted meetups and other organization events. I built a contact form page and did some theme updates and bug fixes for the site. Unfortunately it has been taken down and incorportated into techsoup.org

NetSquared

This was a Drupal project I got early on in my time at TechSoup. Unfortunately it has been taken down and incorportated into techsoup.org. I worked on theme updates page creation and bug fixes for this site.

TechSoup for Libraries

Despite not fitting the typical designer stereotype, my exceptional visual abilities enable me to excel as a presenter, effectively conveying design concepts to stakeholders and design teams. I possess a remarkable aptitude for conceptualization, allowing me to envision and bring forth stunning creations. Additionally, my expertise lies in fine-tuning stylesheets and crafting seamless user experiences that flow effortlessly.
